New Records: England won their second T20 World Cup, becoming the first team to hold both the ODI and T20 World Cup titles.
Ben Stokes scored 51 not out, steering England to victory.
Sam Curran was named Player of the Tournament and Player of the Match for his outstanding performance.
Key Match Events: England won the match by five wickets with six balls to spare.
Key performances from bowlers like Sam Curran and Adil Rashid turned the game in England's favor.
Ben Stokes played a decisive role in the final over, ensuring England's victory.
Pre-Game Insights: England and Pakistan fielded their strongest teams, with key players missing due to injuries.
The match was originally forecast to have potential rain interference, but it didn't affect the outcome.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed immense pride in the team's victory and their resilience.
Ben Stokes was praised by his teammates and opponents for his clutch performance.
Sam Curran highlighted the importance of the team's unity and support during the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a historical moment for England, capping their dominance in white-ball cricket.
The live blog followed the match's progression, providing detailed updates for fans.
The attendance of 80,462 fans showed the significant interest and support for the match.
Others: The match was a rematch of the 1992 ODI World Cup final at the MCG.
Shaheen Afridi's injury during the match was a crucial factor in England's victory.
